intro: Zeuxine stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf zeuxine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other showy wildflowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and delicate, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
